H0.text: From which Daphne DuMaurier book is the opening line 'Last night I dreamt I went to Manderlay again'. Rebecca

H1.text: From which Daphne DuMaurier book is the opening line 'Last night I dreamt I went to Manderlay again'. My Cousin Rachel

H2.text: From which Daphne DuMaurier book is the opening line 'Last night I dreamt I went to Manderlay again'. Jamaica Inn

H3.text: From which Daphne DuMaurier book is the opening line 'Last night I dreamt I went to Manderlay again'. Rifko

A4.text: The novel is remembered especially for the character of Mrs. Danvers, the West Country estate Manderley, which du Maurier's editor noted 'is as much an atmosphere as a tangible erection of stones and mortar', and its opening line: 'Last night, I dreamt I went to Manderley again.'
